alert.note: Alert for Tangipahoa (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 25 at 5:39AM CDT until September 25 at 8:45AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: The National Weather Service in New Orleans has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Tangipahoa Parish in southeastern Louisiana... * Until 845 AM CDT. * At 539 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hammond, Ponchatoula and Natalbany. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 27 and 35. Interstate 12 between mile markers 35 and 41. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
